Denfsov, shaking his orderly by the shoulders and knocking him against the wall. 
"Denfsov, let him alone, I know who has taken it," said Rost6v, going toward the door without raising his eyes. Denisov paused, thought a moment, and, evidently understand- ing what Rost6v hinted at, seized his arm. 
"Nonsense!" he cried, and the veins on his forehead and neck stood out like cords. "You are mad, I tell you. I won't allow it. The purse is here! I'll flay this scoundwel alive, and it will be fou
